body:
Hi all!

Actually I'm using Yowsup but probably WhatsAPI has the same problem.

I have lost two numbers since before yesterday. Maybe the latest update is involved...

Any idea?

Regards.

comment_data.body:
Try registering a number using the official client and use its password for logging in. Make sure WHATSAPP_DEVICE and WHATSAPP_VER match the one you used to register.

Just installed and activated the latest WhatsApp 2.10.506 for Windows Phone 7 and used it's password to log in using 
WHATSAPP_DEVICE="WP7",
WHATSAPP_VER="2.10.506" 
and WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT='WhatsApp/2.10.506 WP7/7.10.8858 Device/HTC-HTC-H0002'

I can log in using the existing password and request a new one using checkCredentials without problems.

Same for me. I registered my account with the official Android-client and used Miss Vernom to get the identity and password. I've changed WHATSAPP_DEVICE, WHATSAPP_VER, WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT and WHATSAPP_TOKEN to the values which my phone has sent. Afterwards I've used WhatsApi to send exactly one message. After some hours my account was blocked.

hmm its getting more serious,

@gowl did something happened exactly before you relogin again. please some logs maybe usefull for anybody.
by my experience php will error on fwrite (sending tx).  whatsapp will never give rx anymore, if you restart the login you will know its blocked by auth-fail .

currently I use some number and still now working, no blocking.

Thank you both! 

So it's too early to know for sure what happens.

the same here  #419

Just activate an account with the latest version of the official client 2.11.2, I will do more tests.

device = 'Android'
whatsAppVer = '2 .11.2 ';
whatsAppUserAgent = 'WhatsApp/2.10.750 Android/4.2.1 Device/GalaxyS3';

I get the code with the official client from BlueStacks and registry using the API

After activated , I use checkCredentials() and it works perfectly.
Send messages perfectly, for now.

@manufuentescr 

In issue #422 , we've established that acks (what the client sends back to the server - like a message received) aren't being done correctly. Perhaps this may play a role in their ban detection algorithms? I'm currently under amnesia from my sedation, so I'm not in the best mood to start analyzing this now. I will very soon though. =)

Wazzap handles acks a lot better:
```
message_ack
notification_ack
delivered_ack
visible_ack
subject_ack

notification_ack:
	notification_groupPictureUpdated
	notification_contactProfilePictureUpdated
	notification_groupPictureRemoved
	notification_contactProfilePictureRemoved
	notification_groupParticipantAdded
	notification_groupParticipantRemoved

message_ack:
	group_messageReceived
	message_received
	group_subjectReceived
	group_imageReceived
	image_received
	group_videoReceived
	video_received
	group_audioReceived
	audio_received
	group_locationReceived
	location_received
	group_vcardReceived
	vcard_received

delivered_ack:
	profile_setStatusSuccess
	receipt_messageDelivered
	receipt_visible	

none:
	contact_typing
	contact_paused
	receipt_messageSent
	receipt_broadcastSent
```

Those are all the events fired in parse incoming message in Wazzap, with their respective acks. 'None' implies that no ack is fired on those events.

Wazzap declares visible_ack and subject_ack, but it doesn't ever use them. 

Take a look at the equivalent WhatsAPI implementation of ack handling, and you can see it is severely incompetent. It sends a message_ack for a notification, for example.

Once this is fixed, and I'm still getting banned (thank God for prepaid cellphone accounts), I'll look into WhatsApp.dll and it's reference dll's that @shirioko gave me =) and see if there's any peculiar protocol changes.

@shirioko 
Can you register a new account using `WhatsApp/2.10.506 WP7/7.10.8858 Device/HTC-HTC-H0002'`
@atans I can generate the right token and client information but I don't have spare numbers to use it on
I had try to use https://github.com/karolsarnacki/whatsapp/blob/master/lib/whatsapp/request/base.rb#L20 token, but it's still not working for register a new number.

@atans That's the one I just referenced above there. It's broken... that's why I stopped everything I was doing to try and fix the issue. :)

Not having WhatsApp on my phone really sucks >.<

@Dynogic I was test galaxys3 token and  work fine yesterday night,
But it was not working when I test it today

It's still on 506, I will be updating it to 523 today so there will be some downtime.
And the fckng app keeps crashing so I have to restart it every few hours. 

But it works.

title: Auth Failed! - Several numbers banned since 2013/07/17.
